topic.title: KODI torrent player
topic.body:
hi, does anybody knows how to play torrents directly in KODI and integrate KODI with Zeronet Play ?.
Thanks

topic.title: Zeronet + Javascript = nowhere
topic.body: please tell me why Javascript knowing the privacy troubles. I jail the execution of Iron or Firefox becuse this but can we expect a Zeronet Javascrip free or this is another NSA honeypot ??

topic.title: Save KODI !
topic.body: KODI is dying. I'm a KODI fan since XBMC. I think it went popular when some idiot wanted to get rich selling the boxes preconfigured. Now nothing works or works for a month and stops. I still think we can save this amazing thing combining it with Zeronet PLAY+ good torrent player. If you want to see a match or TV pay for it.

1_1AqXhGEgfmdaUUsvNp3GL9pueqqLbHMkXp.body: no to1, yes to 2. the plugin and bye bye Hollywood.

how much $ for the plugin ? this is the future in KODI.
1) I can see the PLAY films
2) I click on any, it picks the configured resolution
3) plays the torrent

the otherwise option I'm talking about. zeronet runs in python as well as kodi. I was wondering to just have a plugin to "parse" play and show the movies, on click pass the magnet to a torrent player in kodi. I saw everything separated but we need to glue this in one addon and that is it. I think the parse of the play zite is the key.

It s viewer/parser for PLAY what is needed. there is one from srp.nu for TPB viewer, I changed the url to http://www.uj3wazyk5u4hnvtk.onion and config KODI to use my privoxy with the line forward-socks5 .onion 127.0.0.1:9050 .
The torrent players fail, all of them. YATP, torrenter, Quasar.
I chequed the logs but starting to think KODI does not want this kind of players working. Therefore, with the addon parser for play I mentioned above and a propoer player working the job is done in KODI. Webtorren is a good option but not in the OSMC on RPI.

4_1Jk6iv2QXUgZo4Y4P5ZUKe7SrpMnGs5unL.body: just die. mirror it to Zeronet to get inmortal.

su user -c '/home/user/Programs/ZeroBundle/ZeroNet.sh --ui_ip 192.168.1.100 &'
